text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with almost fat-free green onion
potato salad this is made with just
yogurt as the base no mayo in this so it
was kind of an experiment I'll tell you
later how it came out I'm going to start
by boiling a couple pounds of red
potatoes and while those are boiling in
salted water of course don't forget to
salt your water I'm going to saute the
bottom of a bunch of green onion so I
chopped up the white and light green
parts saute that in a couple tablespoons
olive oil and when those were kind of
soft and golden add a three cloves of
finely minced garlic and just turn that
off just give it a stir there's enough
heat in that oil to cook that garlic and
we're not really cooking the garlic
we're just taking the raw edge off so
really it just needs to sit there in
that hot oil for a little while so
that's good we're going to set that
aside and check our potatoes alright so
once the potatoes are tender you're
going to rinse them in cold water and
when they're just cool enough to handle
I'm going to peel off the skin which
scrapes right off you don't have to but
I like to do that then I'm going to cut
them just in rough chunks about half
inch cubes and toss the salad together
I'm going to add my warm green onion
garlic olive oil mixture to the potatoes
along with lots of black pepper some
cayenne and a big pinch of salt all that
is to taste of course I'll give you
measurements anyway is if I don't you
mad I'm going to toss in the chopped top
half of the green onions and then our
dressing which is yogurt so I just have
some nice nonfat Greek yogurt you can
use low-fat a dollop of mustard I'm
using old-fashioned yellow mustard this
time no Dijon now here's where you're
going to have to kind of be the judge it
seemed a little dry to me so I added in
a little more yogurt so maybe it was
about three quarters of a cup all
together something like that and that
was it so this I thought was a very nice
potato salad when it was
room-temperature I enjoyed it it made a
nice side dish
the next day when it was cold we had
this again and I didn't enjoy it as much
cold I thought that tangy yogurt flavor
really came out when it was cold I
didn't mind it when it was
room-temperature Michelle liked it both
ways she's
was really good so anyway give this a
try if you're looking for a low-fat
potato side dish potato salad side dish
for your barbecues almost non-fat green
onion potato salad go the website all
the ingredients are there there's only a
few and as always enjoy
